result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah N. Nighsonger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Anger management / DV counseling.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $1,700.00 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with the Lenfestey family, or any drug users or dealers, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath. Clerk/H. Barnett. Court imposes a total sentence of 9 years WSP concurrent to 01CF699:  5 years initial confinement w/credit for 881 days served; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; restitution ordered in the amount of $1,700 (by stipulation of deft). No contact with the Lenfestey family, drug users or dealers.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath. Clerk/H. Barnett. State files an amended information. Deft pleads guilty. Court finds deft guilty. PSI ordered. DNA sample ordered. SEH 3/5/18 at 2:15pm. Bond continued.
With Atty McGrath and ADA Krejcarek the time of the PLEAH on 1/25/18 is changed from 2pm to 10:30am.
Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Defendant in custody, by phone, w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath. Clerk/H. Barnett. Case is resolved. PLEAH set for 1/25/18 at 2pm. Bond continued.
With Eric/WI Resource Center the phone appearance set for the STC on 11/20/17 at 1:15pm is rescheduled to 12/13/17 at 2pm.

1/8/16 - Preliminary Hearing

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty. Jodi Meier  kmk

Defendant Sarah N. Nighsonger appeared with Attorney Jodi L Meier.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Det. Eric Traxler; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Meier. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. DE files request for substitution of Br 3; tab pulled for Br 6.   Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued. DA Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
by DE of Br 3; tab pulled for Br 6.

Minutes:   Comm Bielski has a conflict with parties in case and hearing will be adjourned.  Time limits tolled.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
